Package fr.ubx.poo.game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.ubx.poo.game.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addBomb​(Position pos, int range, long start)
      This function is used to add a bomb on a given position, with a given range, at a given time This function doesn't verify if it is allowed to put a bomb on this position, you need to use the function canBomb to put legal bombs
      void addLandmine​(Position pos, int range)
      This function is used to add a landmine on a given position, with a given range This function doesn't verify if it is allowed to put a landmine on this position, you need to use the function canLandmine to put legal landmines
      void addScarecrow​(Position pos)
      This function is used to add a scarecrow on a given position This function doesn't verify if it is allowed to put a scarecrow on this position, you need to use the function canScarecrow to put legal scarecrows
      boolean canBomb​(Position p)
      function used to know if it is possible to put a bomb at a given position
      boolean canLandmine​(Position p)  
      boolean canScarecrow​(Position p)  
      void changeWorld​(int new_level)
      This function is used to notify a game that the World in which the player is has changed (for instance he takes a door)
      void elementsLevelChanged()
      Function used to notify the game that the gameEngine has made the change in case of the elements of the level has been changed
      java.util.List<Box> getBoxes()  
      java.util.List<Box> getBoxes​(int level)  
      java.util.Map<Position,​Explosive> getExplosives()
      This function is used to give all the explosives engines which are currently on the world
      java.util.Map<Position,​Explosive> getExplosives​(int level)
      This function is used to give all the explosives engines which are currently on a given level

      int getNbMonstersKilled()

      this function is used to know what are the theorically new decor (against to the last updating) This function has to be used with elementsLevelChanged to notify that the elements have been placed

      boolean positionAllowedToBoxes​(Position position, int level)
      This function compute if it is possible for a box to go at a given position on a particular level
      boolean positionAllowedToMonsters​(Position position, int level)
      This function compute if it is possible for a monster to go at a given position on a particular level
      boolean positionAllowedToPlayer​(Position position, Direction dir, int level)
      This function compute if it is possible for a player to go at a given position, if he came from a given direction on a particular level
      void update​(long now)
      This function is used by the controller to notify the game that it has to be updated (ie compute interactions between the differents elements) at a given time
      void worldChangeMade()
      Function used to notify the game that the gameEngine has made the change in case of the world has been changed

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game​(java.lang.String worldPath,
            boolean isRandom,
            int nb_levels)
        Parameters:
        worldPath - the path to find the levels in case that the Game is not random and the configuration EVERYTIME you need a valid path !!
        isRandom - if the game is randomly generate or not
        nb_levels - the number of levels that we would like to play in case of isRandom is true. Otherwise, never used.

    • Method Detail

      • changeWorld

        public void changeWorld​(int new_level)
        This function is used to notify a game that the World in which the player is has changed (for instance he takes a door)
        Parameters:
        new_level - The addition of this parameter and the game current level gives the level in which the player is

      • addBomb

        public void addBomb​(Position pos,
                    int range,
                    long start)
        This function is used to add a bomb on a given position, with a given range, at a given time This function doesn't verify if it is allowed to put a bomb on this position, you need to use the function canBomb to put legal bombs
        Parameters:
        pos - the position in which the bomb is put
        range - the range of the bomb
        start - the time that you put a bomb

      • addLandmine

        public void addLandmine​(Position pos,
                        int range)
        This function is used to add a landmine on a given position, with a given range This function doesn't verify if it is allowed to put a landmine on this position, you need to use the function canLandmine to put legal landmines
        Parameters:
        pos - the position in which the landmine is put
        range - the range of the landmine

      • addScarecrow

        public void addScarecrow​(Position pos)
        This function is used to add a scarecrow on a given position This function doesn't verify if it is allowed to put a scarecrow on this position, you need to use the function canScarecrow to put legal scarecrows
        Parameters:
        pos - the position in which the scarecrow is put

      • getExplosives

        public java.util.Map<Position,​Explosive> getExplosives()
        This function is used to give all the explosives engines which are currently on the world
        Returns:
        a Map which contains the Explosive objects at the good locations

      • getExplosives

        public java.util.Map<Position,​Explosive> getExplosives​(int level)
        This function is used to give all the explosives engines which are currently on a given level
        Parameters:
        level - the given level
        Returns:
        a Map which contains the Explosive objects at the good locations

      • elementsLevelChanged

        public void elementsLevelChanged()
        Function used to notify the game that the gameEngine has made the change in case of the elements of the level has been changed

      • hasElementsLevelChange

        public boolean hasElementsLevelChange()
        Function used by the gameEngine to know if elements on the current level have been changed or not
        Returns:
        if there was a level changed

      • hasChangedWorld

        public boolean hasChangedWorld()
        Function used by the gameEngine to know if the level has been changed
        Returns:
        if there was a world change

      • worldChangeMade

        public void worldChangeMade()
        Function used to notify the game that the gameEngine has made the change in case of the world has been changed

      • canBomb

        public boolean canBomb​(Position p)
        function used to know if it is possible to put a bomb at a given position
        Parameters:
        p - the position in which we would like to put a bomb
        Returns:
        if it is possible or not to put a bomb here

      • getPlayerDirection

        public Direction getPlayerDirection()
        Returns:
        the Direction in which the player is theorically going. Useful for the moving policies And to have an abstraction for implementing the Scarecrow decor

      • getPlayerPosition

        public Position getPlayerPosition()
        Returns:
        the Position in which the player is. Useful for the moving policies And to have an abstraction for implementing the Scarecrow decor

      • update

        public void update​(long now)
        This function is used by the controller to notify the game that it has to be updated (ie compute interactions between the differents elements) at a given time
        Parameters:
        now - the given time

      • getNewDecors

        public java.util.Map<Position,​Decor> getNewDecors()
        this function is used to know what are the theorically new decor (against to the last updating) This function has to be used with elementsLevelChanged to notify that the elements have been placed
        Returns:
        A Map corresponding to the new Decor.

      • positionAllowedToMonsters

        public boolean positionAllowedToMonsters​(Position position,
                                         int level)
        This function compute if it is possible for a monster to go at a given position on a particular level
        Parameters:
        position - the given position
        level - the particular level
        Returns:
        if it is possible for a monster to go at this position

      • positionAllowedToPlayer

        public boolean positionAllowedToPlayer​(Position position,
                                       Direction dir,
                                       int level)
        This function compute if it is possible for a player to go at a given position, if he came from a given direction on a particular level
        Parameters:
        position - the given position
        dir - the given direction, usefull because a player can push boxes which depends on the direction
        level - the particular level
        Returns:
        if it is possible for a player to go at this position

                                      int level)
        This function compute if it is possible for a box to go at a given position on a particular level
        Parameters:
        position - the given position
        level - the particular level
        Returns:
        if it is possible for a box to go at this position
